9g8xK2w9e433VrYJSRXeLg.text: Food was lovely, and I really enjoyed it. Great price too. Only issue was my friends poached eggs were over cooked and not runny. She doesn't like to complain so we didn't ask to change them. So we can't complain too much as we didn't let anyone know. But as she said, she was a bit annoyed as we can both make poached eggs ourselves really well. So a bit miffed about that, especially as they are called the breakfast club Oh and they don't do syrups for the coffees?!? What?!? Couldn't get a vanilla latte, and they only do semi-skimmed milk rather than skimmed?!? Bit odd I  Thought everywhere did skinny coffees and flavoured syrups these days.Tried the Canary Wharf branch as thought it would be less of a queue, we still had to wait around 45 minutes. However we had a takeaway coffee whilst we waited And they gave out small samples of smoothie whilst we waited. But the staff were lovely and the food was really nice, just thought it's a bit hyped up. I.e. It's not as great as everyone makes out it is. Great breakfast spot and glad I've been. Not sure if I would bother going again if I have to wait 45 minutes. I mean it was great just not amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. All american breakfast. Streaky bacon, sausage, fried potatoes, two fried eggs, 2 pancakes and maple syrup.

VYEaw3rQ0mvDOR96iOvzjA.text: Very yummy! The benedict eggs were aooooo awesome!  I would like to visit again!

KCC9rA6kpdUSFqqKqjfqdQ.text: Good cheap and fast wouldn't recommend the kale salad. Otherwise everything is pretty good and most importantly great value for money. If you are more than two people I'd recommend to book. Good place for lunch during the week in canary wharf.

XlJfqUGX9OiVdqFvIsF3mQ.text: Always expect a queue with the Breakfast Club, and this venue is no different. Took us a while to find the new crossrail building but when we did there were plenty of places to eat, and The Breakfast Club managed to find us a few spots at the counter which worked fine. Food was good as always and we were also able to try some milkshake which was very tasty!

QxICnPkehSCBwcvaB0dSEA.text: I would honestly give this restaurant 0 stars if I could. A good friend of mine has been recommending the chain for quite some time and we finally went today. We had a party of 4 and waited approximately 45 minutes to an hour for a table which is insane. (I personally never wait in lines for a restaurant and I will never do it again). Once we were seated, we ordered coffees and beverages which took 25 minutes to arrive at our table. There were customers that were seated after us and had received their food before we did. When we finally were served, the food was cold. The wait staff was awful for a well known brunch spot on a Sunday afternoon and the line wouldn't have been so long had the workers been more efficient and taken 20+ minutes to make a mocha and americano. Overall, the quality of the food doesn't come anywhere near the price and it was such a bad experience that I won't even venture to one of the other Breakfast Clubs to see if this one (in Canary Wharf) was having a bad day. (Not to mention that staff and baristas behind the bar were texting in between making drinks/delivering food to tables. Quite unsanitary). Try a non-chain, unique, local, place in London. Stray far away from this place.

OE3yw2pABp0NnSHrK8Z1Eg.text: Quite disappointing to be honest. Egg Benedict wasn't good. Pancake is not too bad. Service is super slow on a Sunday morning.

95TtAnoADkUqP5HFhbuWyw.text: As am American in London this was a really pleasing taste of home. The place can get crazy during lunchtime so you should book a table in advance. The takeout menu is popular but more limited than the main menu which has a full diner selection. I had the salmon eggs Benedict which was great. Service was a bit slow but the servers were great. Good coffee was a big plus.

89nAtoqSyh41quQYEPhdjQ.text: Fantastic food. I will be coming again. Great service. Pancakes are yummy. Good music. I love jazz and American tempo.

77hIh4bBbfoWSeLJ1dSu7w.text: Vistited with friends on a weekend. Slightly overrated but enjoyable experience overall

R7_ZwTvAwejbTlYxt66nTQ.text: Surprisingly good. Had the Eggs Benedict and it was lovely. Make sure you go hungry as the portions are huge.

BS5FtHbjuKcxZ9gWMYT-Yw.text: Another 'The Breakfast Club' to try and as usual, it didn't disappoint! It is not as cozy as the one in Angel or as genuine as the one in Hoxton (before the refurbishment) or has a cool fridge like the one in Liverpool Street, but the food is as good as it is in any of the other ones. It is bigger on the inside than it looks from the outside and we didn't have trouble finding a table for 4 on a Sunday evening. The stage is very 60s-70s and massive compared to the one in Hoxton. There was not live music when we went. but they had the program hanging on the walls.The food was good as always. At first, I wanted the famous pancakes and berries, but I decided that real food was better at that time and had the halloumi wrap and a milkshake and both were delicious. My friends seemed satisfied as well with their food, so we left the place happy and full.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Eggs menu!

2kWxyg2BYMOEKdlYN30kyA.text: I had breakfast with a co-worker here today. She was like 'Christian, we're running late for work, you should hurry.'And I was like 'Woman, I ain't going to work on an empty stomach, let me enjoy my food.' It was great and it was so worth to being late. What to get: the FULL Monty. They also offer a half, but don't underrate yourself, you can take the full. It includes a tasty, big sausage as well as eggs, delicious fried potatoes, mushrooms, grilled tomato, heaven bacon and God, I forgot what else.What's great: the pancakes are a must try! The smoothies seemed great, but I haven't tried them yet. Oh, they also have cocktails and alcohol drinks, yaaas.What's great for me: the alcohol drinks. And there is a breakfast burrito. Burrito. Breakfast. Burrito. This is also in my area, which means I'll be visiting probably more often that I should. They have a daquiri named HEMINGWAY DAQUIRI. Favourite cocktail and writer, do I need to say more?

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. What even...
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Did I say pancakes or what?

PquNXM4lPG4GCMVVk6emiw.text: I recently moved in the Canary Wharf area, and was really pleased to discover there is a Breakfast Club there now! I've been disappointed by some Breakfast Club branches in the past, which have become too touristy, but thought I would give this one a try.First of all, because it's not in the center, there is much less queue than at some BC, so we didn't wait too long to get a table (this might change after the Crossrail opens, but we will see). I loved the inside. You enter through a bar/cafe area, and the main restaurant is upstairs and much bigger that other BC  one of the other reason why you don't queue too much maybe too. The setting is really like an Old American Dinner, but don't go there for a quiet moment, as it is really noisy.I think not all BC are equals in terms of quality of food but this one didn't disappoint, the menu offers all the BC classics served in huge quantities, and their pancakes are still very good :)Maybe a bit of a slowish service but it was ok as we were not in a hurry, and the staff was very friendly.We definitely go back now that it is so close to home! :)

3EB3r2uJa44wW96vsKj1ZQ.text: I really love breakfast and I was excited to try this place out on a Monday morning. I purposely waited til after 9am to visit as I thought it might be full of office-types before that but it was pretty empty when I arrived. I ordered eggs royale with a side of avocado as well as home-style fried potatoes. My food arrived pretty quickly and looked beautiful. Sadly one egg had a really tiny yolk (sad times), some of the avocado was in massive chunks and the potatoes were pretty meh. I've had many an eggs royale in my time and this was pretty sub-standard - and expensive! Positives were that the staff were really friendly and the place is pretty cool, decor-wise. I wouldn't rush back though. Surely there must be a good breakfast option in Canary Wharf?!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Royale with added avocado and potatoes

ptCdCKssjCnj-oev95-xDA.text: I got a takeaway lunch of pulled pork bun and absolutely enjoyed it. The pulled pork was just adequately seasoned and infused with cheese, and perfectly complemented by the red cabbage and pickles. Service was kind and prompt -- it was off-peak hours, so we were able to converse a bit too. Space inside is nothing fancy, but it looked like it could get the job done if you're looking for a quick, casual meal near your office. Would definitely go back for another lunch or even dinner!

WCjTlWxJjbqFQWyZ5IUc_w.text: Smart to go here on the weekends for brunch because it is a little out of the way so there isn't much of a wait. Delicious options all around. I got huevos al Benny and was very pleased as we're all my dining mates with their choices. It's pretty dark in there but plays good music. Our waitress was super sweet. Would go again and likely will.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Cappuccino
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Huevos al benny

QXvXMs1O-Gp9Gj6tiEGLBw.text: Food is decent, staff is a good laugh, good deal, get in now before it gets too popular.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Sitting upstairs with mates getting drunk and laughing our heads off ... love the Breakfast Club.

Mj3R2ppvXDprbsIbxU0blg.text: Great atmosphere. Greeted warmly. Food is great as well had the All American filled me up could not finish everything on my plate.Checked up on regularly by staff.

NfEYY0GtHWTDNgayOrpnug.text: Shared pancakes and then breakfast burrito with a friend and both were delicious, especially the pancakes.

UKfX3taBNFhA1fozXkfVpg.text: This place is great.  The best breakfast I've ever had.  They use great ingredients.  The service was good and it was worth the wait.  I was a little depressed before this because I struck out a couple of times.  This place restored my faith in humanity.  Who says food in UK sucks!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. No joke!

_W5l-OcBrfip9rNfq1zR6Q.text: Service was really slack, and 4 of us from a party of 8 were unwell the next day!I only drank there too so I think there was an issue with the cleanliness of glasses.Othe halves drink was watered down and not the whisky he asked for.Won't be returning.

YLmZQpCZEqNLxlf9b5ghnQ.text: Really tasty American style breakfast but WAY overpriced. I know it's London but still - 10£ for eggs bacon and pancakes? The servers are awful as well - we nearly walked out after waiting ages for anyone to come over. Ended up reaching behind us at the server station to get a jug of water because despite asking, no one would bring us any. The restaurant was near empty when we arrived and we asked for a booth as there were a few other 2 person parties sitting there and the hostess had to go speak to a manager to see if we would be allowed to sit there.Honestly, avoid this place and make yourself a decent breakfast at home. Overpriced hipster crap.

t7WU1ibRyXbyZ6QjTD34ig.text: Ohhh Breakfast Club! I love this place! That's my favourite breakfast place in London (so far) I went to 3 different Breakfast Club and in any of them I have been disappointed. You might have to queue but for this one, Saturday morning 10.45, we were 5 and did not wait for a table! Lucky maybe? The staff, so so nice, funny and helpful. (And that's valid for the 3 breakfast club I have been to : wardour street, Hoxton/ old street and this one carnarby street) Now the food: OMG, especially their pancakes! This time I choose Benedict eggs with potatoes, excellent and the pancakes with vanilla cream and berries. I was full and could not finish the pancakes so I would suggest you go for eggs and share the pancakes with one person on your table. Drinks: nothing extraordinary, drinks are ok, juices is freshly pressed, just what you need. Finally the bill: payed £18 (we shared the bill) for benedict eggs with potatoes, a latte and pancakes. This is reasonable I think especially that I was not hungry until 7 in the evening!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Latte at Breakfast Club
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Eggs benedict with ham. Yummy
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Pancakes with vanilla cream and berries. EXCELLENT!

VSzPkw8_uVZ1upOm_NmreQ.text: My coworkers told me about this place and we decided to head over one Friday for lunch. They advised that we get there right at noon to ensure a seat as they typically fill up toward 12:30. They were right and we were able to get a cosy both in the upstairs room.The décor is whimsical and fun taking me back to an old American diner. Upstairs there is also a stage for bands and a bar area. Looks like a fun place to come to in the evenings.We all decided on breakfast for lunch and were not disappointed. I ordered the 'huevos rancheros' while my other two ladies ordered the 'all american' and 'berry pancakes'. My dish was not what I was expecting from my pervious experience with this Mexican dish, but it was still very good and flavourful. I also got to take a few bites of the amazingly fluffy and sweet pancakes. Nice work Breakfast Club, how do you do it!We were all satisfied with our meals and overall experience. The servers were very nice and made us feel at home. The price is a little more than I like to pay for lunch, but as a special treat on a Friday, it hit the spot.

qStRn-Lf3T6lEIGsnYz1kw.text: Totally understand the hype of this place because it is absolutely fantastic. We came here at 1pm on a Sunday afternoon and there was a long line out the door. We were told a 15-20 minute wait but because there was only 2 of us we had the option to be seated at the bar. The staff here is super friendly no matter how busy it got. Every item on their menu looked delicious and I love the cozy feel of the place. My recommendation is the All American Breakfast. The pancakes were a dream! They were so light and fluffy and perfectly sweet I'll definitely be coming back here :) My only kink is that the food took FOREVER to come and people that ordered after us were served first.

cb4evPcL-b8IdZPCFwkeOg.text: If you don't mind a wait on a weekend morning there is no more enjoyable restaurant for brunch. The food is absolutely delicious. I always take my friends and family to TBC when they're visiting London and nobody has left less than immensely satisfied. The only down side is having to wait for a table and that you will have zero reception when inside the building. Also, there's no public wi-fi.

0sANViv06nix7iHEvqEGHQ.text: I visited the newest addition to the popular Breakfast Club franchise in Canary Wharf's Crossrail Place during their soft launch on Saturday the 2 May 2015 with my boyfriend. We have eaten at their Spitalfields location several times over the past couple of years, enjoying their American inspired brunches and the charm and nostalgia entrenched in the BC brand. The décor ranges from the famous 'Bacon Rolls' neon sign to memorabilia that anyone who was born or lived through the 80s can appreciate (He-Man? Check. My Little Pony? You bet.) The environment is cool, the music is loud and the waiting staff are appropriately aloof and disillusioned. The menu presents a good variety of solid brunch options from pancake stacks (with real maple syrup on the side) to the Full Monty (Bacon, sausage, black pudding, eggs, home-style fried potatoes, mushrooms, beans, grilled tomato and toasted multigrain bloomer) with a 'Reggie the Veggie' vegetarian counterpart. There are butties, omelets, eggs Benedict and healthy muesli on offer as well.The BC is notorious for spiraling queues of bleary-eyed teenagers and hipsters, so we made a reservation (always recommended with this chain) and strolled past the queue to be seated upstairs immediately. The Canary Wharf branch has a bar area and some tables downstairs, but the main restaurant is on the second floor. There is a good amount of cafeteria style seating with booth seating available. All of the problems we encountered during our meal were either typical to the BC or can be attributed to the soft launch, namely: music randomly cutting out, languid and inattentive service, no waiter in sight for water/drinks refills, overcooked eggs and slightly cold food delivered. However, based on my experience with the Spitalfields branch, some of these things are typical of the chain because it is a victim of its own success- we previously had issues with inattentive staff and speed of service because waiters are run off their feet.Despite this, the food is generous and the BC is undoubtedly a consistent winner when it comes to brunch- on this visit, my boyfriend had the Full Monty and was pleased with his dish; it's the perfect cornucopia for the indecisive who desire every breakfast staple in one place. The pancakes are consistently good here, coming out fluffy and perfectly golden every time. Real Canadian maple syrup is provided in a separate ramekin on the side- this is a pointless flourish for Canadians like me, who immediately pour it over everything and then look for the full bottle. However, my English boyfriend resolutely safeguarded his eggs and sausages from any sweetness and didn't use the entire portion provided to him (philistine!).My Eggs Royale arrived as two poached eggs slathered in hollandaise and decorated with a sprinkling of chilly powder, bouncing on large muffins with smoked salmon spilling out of the sides. The portion of salmon was good, the hollandaise was as expected and the muffins were floury and filling. I am extremely finicky about poached eggs and found my eggs to be both cold and overdone- one was still only just runny while the other was a solid yoke. I acknowledged that I couldn't tolerate a further wait to rectify this issue and begrudgingly tucked in.We are hoping that most of the crowd had travelled into this branch of the Breakfast Club specifically because of the soft launch discount on food, as it would be nice to have a quieter incarnation of the restaurant for spontaneous brunching. Despite the blips experienced during our meal, I do like the BC and it's the perfect environment to relax in on a Sunday morning with a young, hip crowd. The food is good value, the portions aren't stingy and they offer some great food combinations that sets them apart from other brunch hotspots in London. They also have an extensive menu that will cater to everyone's tastes.It's worth a trip to see for yourself, but expect a long queue and paced service- make sure you order a jug of smoothie or a large coffee while you wait for your food to arrive, but at least there's a lot of kitsch on the walls to keep you entertained while you wait.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Benedict

9quhFC36v3iqBYvKuMR-Gw.text: Fantastic! Had the buttermilk chicken burger and it was delicious. Girlfriend got the pancakes, she's american and said they were the best pancakes she's had in the UK.  Was super impressed by the price as well, ended up coming to only £20. Deffo worth a visit. Decor is great too.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Girlfriend drinking lovely iced tea

XjZi_-XvnbREQ2Cnu9km2Q.text: I have been to breakfast clubs before, I get and understand the design of the places. The focus is on high quality breakfasts in small venues with limited staff. It's not unusual to see large queues to these places snaking around the corner as people patiently wait for a griddle breakfast to start their Saturday. This really doesn't work in Canary Wharf though given we have jobs to get back to. It took me three attempts to get a table here, I know I can't blame them for being popular- they have just opened. I can blame them for being chronically understaffed, like their other venues, which is presumably to make it as profitable as possible. Anyway the food! The menu at this BC is a bit more limited than the others, despite being larger. No French toast for some reason. Our table tried the full monty (fry up), the half monty (smaller fry up), huevos al benny (eggs benedict with chorizo and avocado) and chorizo hash browns. The food was pretty disappointing. Whilst the quality of the individual ingredients was decent, they were poorly put together meals. Whether it be the muffin on the eggs benedict being like a rock, the hash brown being soggy and undercooked or the fry ups just being a bit dry and bland - the cooking wasn't very executed.  For a ten pound fry up you would expect a bit of excitement on your plate but there wasn't even anything like black pudding or a fried slice. The sausage was rather nice but then again, how do you mess up a sausage if it's good quality?All in all a disappointing breakfast made worse by the hurdles I had to jump through to eventually dine there. I would highly recommend "Docklands Diner" nearby instead.

WuZI1PJSxrmXmstYiaNn1Q.text: Best breakfast in London. From the simple sausage butty to the fantastic pancakes. Everything here is just delish. The last time I was there, I had the pastrami sandwich, and it was so thick and so good. Layers of pastrami just perfect.

U9QRHkz37vK4ZAAteQOGDQ.text: It is a good place to relax.There is a large assortment of dishes and appetizers: pancakes, eggs florentine, sandwiches, toasts, pastries and even more. In This cafe has it is a pleasant atmosphere and a wonderful coffee is served there.I like to spend my time there.  I recommend this place to everyone!

5h0Y2HkfP2khql1B3WZsdQ.text: The vibes were pretty cool and the food was tasty but it wasn't mind blowing. The brunch menu here is a mixture of American and Mexican twists. I got the Huevos Al Benny with fried chicken. It's two poached eggs served with avocado, choice of chorizo or fried chicken, peppers, and hollandaise sauce, on English muffins. Eggs were perfectly runny and the hollandaise sauce makes perfect sense. The fried chicken was crispy but lacked flavor as did the avocado and peppers. Overall the dish could use more seasoning. Also got a side of fries to go with my meal but the portion was small. The highlight of brunch was actually the free arcade game machine by the stairs. My friend and I definitely spent a good 20 minutes here on a 1v1!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Huevos Al Benny with fried chicken

Rn1CZrgJfYZ1SLKbbG9gmQ.text: Leave any expectations of healthy eating at the door. The menu is chock full of naughty dishes, ranging from American classics to Mexican twists. It's a fun menu to go through but damn, the font is small. For you non-Millennials out there, bring your reading glasses. I may have ordered wrong but the chicken wrap was only so-so. Nothing inherently wrong but it wasn't that memorable either. But the atmosphere is fun and you can sit in a booth (!!) so I would definitely come back.

LqcVYIbZ1Uswpmmmjo-FYg.text: We made a dinner reservation for 9pm (on a night they were supposed to close at midnight) on our night of arrival in London. After finding the restaurant, we walked in and there was no one to be found. We finally saw someone in the kitchen through the open window and flagged them down. They said the kitchen was closed.... I explained that we had a reservation. I was told that they have no record of our reservation but if we wanted we could go to the bar in the back and order apps they would be able to accommodate us... So, the kitchen is closed... but we can order apps from the kitchen....? Didn't make sense, but we were hungry, so we headed to the back. The kitschy décor which we found left a lot to be desired. It looked like it hadn't been dusted in years... Perhaps that's the look they were going for? I don't know. When we attempted to order apps and drinks the bartender said that we missed last call, and the kitchen was closed... It was only 9:15 at the latest at this point. Very frustrating. I felt like I was on a hidden camera show and the joke was on me.... Waste of time!

sFY7ZwJxfr2VZVK8Hxyxaw.text: I love the very chilling and 80s American atmosphere of this place.I came here for breakfast with my sister and we had a great time there.The staff was very friendly and fast. I ordered the veggie all American with an English breakfast tea and my sister had the all American with orange juice.We were served very quickly and it was really good !!!The food was delicious and very fulfill ! The price is pretty ok for the quantityI recommend this place for a nice and chilling breakfast/brunch

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

2kRQjUnQ6F8l_ZEKgDQJdw.text: Did some research online, this is one of the best English breakfast places and most importantly open on Sunday. Very old school interior design, good food good service.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

yIGdQbcMvMizOo0BtkOHiw.text: We arrived at the restaurant, in the recently completed Crossrail Place area, at around 2 pm on a gloomy Saturday afternoon. We were fortunate to grab one of the last tables available and settled into a delicious bacon cheeseburger and The Full Monty (sausage, poached eggs, mushrooms, tomato, black pudding, potatoes)Simple food, good portion size, well prepared and tasty. Good service and reasonably priced, £35 for 2 persons with a tea and a salted caramel milk shake inc service.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Cheeseburger

BLL8eB5H9NikmwAHvgafGQ.text: Oh well The Breakfast Club !!! I heard mixed things about it ! This location is the only branch that I have been AND I liked it !! I love the interior design here. It has the 80s American Retro Diner feeling in it. They put  a gigantic shiny disco ball over the entrance staircase. It is quite interesting.You enter through a bar area, and the main restaurant is upstairs. It is spacious!! I went there for breakfast couple times, my favorite was the full Monty !!! You can never go wrong and the pancakes were solid too !! I heard from my mates, Happy hour is from 5-7pm happy hour and cocktails for £5 with a few things on the menu if you are craving for a bite as well. Every item serves with skin-on fries. I guess if you are up for mildly wasted in an affordable price and full belly after work. This is your spot hahaThe service was on the slow side but staffs were warm and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. When that shiny bun of the crispy chicken sandwich is saying Hello to you. Hey.. you bite it ! ;)

dKk25MQwS8VtK2Gubp-v2w.text: Delicious! My husband had the breakfast burrito and I enjoyed the full Monty! Service is quick. They aren't too chatty with you but that shouldn't discourage you from trying it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

cp-aVX2oR1LNI9Z_q_GOvg.text: One of the best places to get pancakes, whether you like them sweet or savoury... breakfast club serves them up generously and damn tasty!!!!

-N12SYc9WRFL2b6SugDDkQ.text: My friend and I dropped by for brunch on a Sunday morning. We had about a 25 minute wait, a line formed outside, across from the entrance. It wasn't a huge line, but took a while to get moving. By the time we left after we'd eaten, it was double the length!The restaurant is actually quite large and I do like the decor and feel of TBC's. Service wasn't the quickest, but it was friendly. I had the Heuvos Al Benny with potatoes and my friend had Heavos Rancheros with a side of fruit. I've had the same dish at one of their other locations and it was nicer. I wasn't very impressed this time. The meals were ok, and I will probably visit again when I'm in the mood for an American style breakfast, but might try something a different dish next time.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. All American w/side of mushrooms
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. All American
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

mDkXQbWxfvExO8E2VpSyYg.text: Neat place with decent breakfast/lunch options.  Has a fun late 70s/early 80s decor obviously inspired by many of the famous movies from the time. Good quick service with typical food options for a breakfast place. Food was decent but not amazing. Would recommend if you are looking for a traditional American style breakfast or one with a British twist.

nfC7-oO7DOzvS2gO2M_t4Q.text: Really comfortable, quirky place with really decent food.  Nice attentive staff, awesome coffee, funny mugs, sweet tees, brilliant slogans, over easy eggs, baked potatoes, generally delicious everything.

qbjlPC26iB_chaTeNnuzdw.text: Food was a pretty good, but we received excellent service by maybe the manager? This is about the service we received. Can't remember his name. Male with tats and very nice. He was very attentive to my girlfriends restrictions and helped her find something delicious. He checked up on us several times. I appreciate excellent customer service. Ambiance is great!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Band stage area
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Florentine with squash bread instead of bread

MRNcnFH7B2V5hRfFzuWyxw.text: Fast and friendly service. Hearty, filling breakfast of pancakes, bacon & fried egg. I'm set for the day!

s1KPRDlm6xt6Lh-RQvWUTg.text: Very very average because of the poor QUALITY of the food and the ingredients. Full English was very bland bordering on unpleasant! It was made with no love whatsoever, certainly on the tastebuds front. Awful and overpriced springs to mind. And similarly were my partner's American pancakes. The bacon tasted cheap and industrial. Same for the eggs (over cooked) and sausage. The setting is pseudo London cafe in the 60s but I'd rather have a real greasy spoon if the food is better. The Ledger Building (a Wetherspoon pub) just 10 minutes away is arguably five times better in terms of taste. And I'm just trying the Docklands Diner so I'll let you know.

3c3bRwOGsCHdhAY54ouVsQ.text: We came here with our British friends for a full English breakfast and it did not disappoint. My husband got the cabbies breakfast and it was delicious. I had a breakfast sandwich (was missing the avocado but did not mention it) and it was good as well. Good size portions. We both had filtered coffee and got refills for £1(which is not common here). The waitress was delightful. We were with a group of 13 and she was very accommodating. Highly recommend

D2hGkLDrbbBtFi2NPhG0RA.text: Went to The Breakfast Club and ordered a burger with sweet potato fries. Overall, the food was good and the ambience was retro very 80s looking which was cool. This restaurant was okay, I thought the service could be better.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Burger with some sweet potato fries

HXL2AsGC33WjJLN8t_idng.text: Breakfast was delicious, tunes were even better. Coffee was one of the best filter coffees I've had. Would have liked refills tho. I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Huevos Rancheros

si_RLCEHX-h_XAf0VMfabQ.text: This is the latest outpost of the BC chain, and big enough inside that you should avoid the dreaded queues of the city sites. We were looking for a fairly speedy dinner in the area before heading to the nearby Cineworld, so decided to try it out.By a stroke of luck we made it 15mins before their 5-7pm happy hour ended, so I went for a Rosie and Gin cocktail for £5. I was torn between a few things on the menu (always a good problem to have!) but eventually went for the buttermilk fried chicken burger which was really tasty, a good size and held together well. I liked the spicy jalapeno coleslaw in with the chicken which gave it a good kick, and it was served with skin-on fries. My date had the chilli bowl, which I think he enjoyed but looked a little rice-heavy from my perspective across the table.As always they've gone all out on the retro decor - this one is more evening-orientated than others, like a 60's social club that I think does actually have live acts some evenings. I do love dedication to a theme so obv it works, sealed by the gigantic shiny disco ball suspended over the entrance staircase. I thought the service could have been a little more attentive considering they weren't very busy on a Tues eve, but both our servers were very friendly and welcoming (once we got their attention). Overall you know what you're getting with BC - and this one executes it well :)
